The original idea of making an if-else chain was good, but your change was converting the originally unnatural checks sequence into another unnatural checks sequence. I submitted another PR which puts checks in a more optimistic order https://github.com/leethomason/tinyxml2/pull/260 Thanks for the idea.

Hi, I just wanted to notify you that we use azure as our webhost. So in the future(when you look into implementing app uploading) remember to use the azure blob storage API :)

As far as i can tell [the SSL problems](https://www.irccloud.com/pastebin/946ittrP) are caused due to lack of [SNI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Server_Name_Indication) support (I believe Java <= 6).

SNI "allows multiple secure (HTTPS) websites [...] to be served off the same IP address without requiring all those sites to use the same certificate"

We're running Crafatar behind CloudFlare and since they proxy quite a few sites they have to use SNI.

I [found this](http://jafag.blogspot.de/2008/12/java-ssl-no-subject-alternative-matched.html), maybe that workaround could work? I don't know if this makes it insecure, though.

Nice!

Since this is a promise handler, you can also fix it using [.bind()](https://github.com/petkaantonov/bluebird/blob/master/API.md#binddynamic-thisarg---promise). This is what I use in the rest of the code too.

So it would look like:

```javascript
CompanySubmit.submit(data)
.bind(this)
.then(function()
{
    submitForm.showThanks(this.getFullStateList('none'));
})
```

I've merged your PR, thanks

Hi T,

The var should be called LIBMCRYPT_VERSION as its only connection to PHP is that libmcrypt is used to build the mcrypt PHP ext. The two projects are not related in any other way.

Why not consider Warns as errors? Here is an example of a Warn that can be returned for a malformed CustomerQueryRq which prevents the query from executing. 
```
<?xml version=\"1.0\" ?><QBXML><QBXMLMsgsRs><CustomerQueryRs statusCode=\"500\" statusSeverity=\"Warn\" statusMessage=\"The query request has not been fully completed. There was a required element ("bleech") that could not be found in QuickBooks.\" /></QBXMLMsgsRs></QBXML>
```

Yes, but this is aliasing, which I started on, but somewhat abandoned, due to all sorts of nuanced bugs that kept creeping up.

In no way should we modify dynamic14 to some how know about dynamic2014, or 2014 to know about 14.  The alias 'concept' was good idea, but it simply had enough issues that I am not sure it will ever be solid enough to release prime time.
Well, we could add magic markers that instruct rustdoc to use the doc-comment of some other item, but that shouldn’t block this PR.

我不是很确认，但似乎这次 commit 引入一个bug。我升级 nobone 最新版后，之前通过 `kit.monitorApp` 监听并重启 server 的代码会频繁报这个错：
```
events.js:72
        throw er; // Unhandled 'error' event
              ^
Error: listen EADDRINUSE
```

看起来是没有正确处理程序的退出。
